February 6, 2017, Evan was senior to Michael but didn’t manage directly

Michael is a talented educator, community leader, and remarkable autodidact. I had the honor and pleasure of working with Michael in my role as Director of Instructional Design, and he remains one of my professional heroes. As a Lead Instructor, Michael demonstrated the oft-forgotten difference between ’telling’ and ’teaching’. He cared deeply about each student, maintained high expectations, and went above and beyond the call of duty to provide differentiated instruction. Michael was willing to do whatever it took to ensure each student reached their full potential. His efforts produced some of the strongest Web Development cohorts in my time at Galvanize. In his current role as Curriculum Developer, Michael helps shape the trajectory of the Web Development Immersive, producing high-quality blended materials that allow Galvanize to provide exceptional experience at scale. Galvanize is fortunate to have Michael.Outside of the classroom, Michael works tirelessly to give back to the software development community. He leads several Meetup groups that provide junior and senior developers alike the opportunity to come together and learn from each other. In volunteering this time, Michael models what it looks like to ‘pay it forward’ and be a steward of the profession. The Denver software community is fortunate to have Michael.And finally, Michael exhibits an insatiable appetite for feedback and personal growth that I strive to emulate. He models a ‘hacker’ mentality, never hesitating to jump in, make mistakes, and get his hands dirty. The growth mindset that he exhibits is the secret ingredient in education, and as he advances in his career and flexes his pedagogical muscles further, he’ll make a significant dent in the field  at large. The education community is fortunate to have Michael.I give Michael my highest recommendation and hope that our paths cross again soon. If you have the opportunity to hire him, don't pass it up.

Michael wrote this incredible python course, actually two courses, which is the fastest, most effective way to learn the python programming language that I have seen. Michael's work beats all others hands down. Other courses assume you know things adjacent to but barely outside their narrow scope and leave you to fend for yourself. Not Michael. He covers everything you need to know to get going for web development. His work is comprehensive yet focused on just what you need.

February 1, 2017, Evan worked with Michael in the same group

Evan is a teacher, developer, and community leader. After graduating from the Galvanize Full Stack Web Development program in 2015, he joined the company as an Instructor. He was promoted several times, eventually becoming the Director of Instructional Design. In this role he transformed education at Galvanize, adding in experiential learning, data-driven instruction, and mastery tracking. As a Lead Instructor, he helped me personally become not only a better teacher and leader in the classroom but a better person in life. Aside for his instructional design skills, Evan thinks and acts like a developer. The way he is able to break problems down into manageable pieces is simply beautiful, to say the least. Regardless of the language or framework, he is able to view problems in a different light than most. Plus, he can communicate with almost any stakeholder making him invaluable to any software team. He is a strong technical writer as well. Galvanize is lucky to have had him for as long as they did. I am confident that they would not have been able to scale education as much as they did without him. I am lucky to have worked with him, and I hope that I will have the privilege to do so again sooner rather than later.
